Key Arguments: The free flow of information is crucial for personal safety and should not be restricted by governments or regulatory bodies.
The bill grants excessive power to decide what constitutes misinformation and disinformation, which should not be given to any entity.
The bill is perceived as a tool for government control and censorship rather than a genuine attempt to combat misinformation.
Historical examples show that censorship by governments often leads to abuse of power and crimes against humanity.
The bill exempts major perpetrators of misinformation, such as governments and media, demonstrating hypocrisy and criminal intent.
Main Themes: Hypocrisy and Exemption of Major Entities
Notable Quotes: THE RIGHT TO HAVE INFORMATION ABOUT AN IMPENDING DANGER OR ATTACK ON YOU IS YOUR ABSOLUTE RIGHT AND YOUR PRIMARY FORM OF DEFENCE AND PROTECTION
This Bill Is A Total Fraud And Deception, It Is Treason And IS ITSELF THE WORST BUT AND DISINFORMATION.

The bill provides for the @@ EXEMPTION@@ of the biggest perpetrators of not only Misinformation and Disinformation but barefaced and premeditated Lies THAT ARE INTENDED TO DO THE PEOPLE ENORMOUS HARM AND CAUSE DEATHS.
